sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The level 3 of translations groups together the components of the installation process which are not always been used. These steps are optional steps and do no occur on default installs.
All packages which interact with users during second stage optional steps are considered part of the level 3 of the &d-i; localization.

This includes the following Debian packages:
popularity-contest
aptitude
pppconfig
xdebconfigurator
localization-config
console-common
dictionaries-common

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The popularity-contest (very often nicknamed as popcon) package is automatically installed on every Debian system as it is part of what is called the base system.

This package installs scripts which periodically send to Debian Developers statistics about installed packages on the local system. These statistics are used when building releases, for instances for getting informations about the most used architecture ports as well as the most used packages.

Of course, as the Debian Project is highly committed to the respect of its users privacy, this survey is disabled by default. So, when the package is installed, it prompts the user whether (s)he wants to activate this survey system.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the popularity-contest package.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: Translators must be very careful with this specific translationÂ : keep the prompt very clear as it is in English and keep it short.

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The aptitude program is an combination of interactive and non-interactive tools for installing Debian packages. For long-time users of Debian, it may be seen as the replacement for both dselect and apt-get.
It is used from base-config when packages are installed. It is also used interactively when the user chooses the option for installing individual packages of his/her choice.
The program uses a text-based menu system when used interactively and includes a lot of output messages when it is run non-interactively.

aptitude's full translation is a huge work because there are hundreds of strings in the POT file. Moreover, this requires some good knowledge of several Debian package managements concepts. It is recommended that this translation is handled by an experienced Debian system administrator.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: This package is a regular Debian package. The package maintainer uses a SVN repository for the program development (the Debian package is handled in a separate SVN repository).

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the aptitude package.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: Without any doubt, aptitude's translation is among the most difficult translations involved in &d-i; translation. It has an impact far outside &d-i; because aptitude is likely to be used all along the life of a Debian system.
Several strings in aptitude PO file are menu entries, pseudo dialog boxes text and all such limited size material. The source code is not very widely commented to help out translators.

The ideal way to translate aptitude is by recompiling the software and include the translation to be tested. Compiling aptitude requires usual build tools and software as well as a few dedicated libraries such as apt libraries.

Aptitude also includes a small help file, which may be translated as well. However, this translation does not use GNU gettext, so the translation is quite tricky. See the help* files in aptitude's source tree.
Aptitude's documentation may also be translated. See the doc/ directory in the package's source tree.

Translators should be aware that aptitude is still under heavy development, so upstream strings are very likely to change or be added. Anyway, even a partial translation will help the users of a given language.

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The pppconfig package configures PPP systems. It helps the users in configuring one or several PPP peers as well as the PPP interface details.
It is installed and configured from base-config when run at medium priority (thus, for expert installs).
The program uses a dialog-like interface for building a set of menus which the users navigate in.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: This package is a regular Debian package. The package maintainer currently does no use any CVS or SVN repository.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the pppconfig package.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: The paragraph formatting is hard-coded with "\n" which represents carriage returns. Translators must be careful about keeping the lines below 72 characters even if this ends in more or less "\n" then the original English file. This does not harm though some PO editing tools are likely to output warnings about this as well as the msgfmt utility.
pppconfig has a fairly high number of very long strings, so this translation is among those requiring the hardest work in all &d-i; translation work.

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The xdebconfigurator package is a tool aimed at automatic configuration of the X-Window server component (most often when users choose the installation of the desktop task.
It is called from base-config when the installed system includes a X Window System server software.
The only translatable string is the package description, used as a menu entry in base-config.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: The xdebconfigurator package is maintained by the Debian-Edu project maintainers and is part of Debian-Edu's SVN repository.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the xdebconfigurator package.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: The translatable part only includes the base-config menu entry. It must be kept short: below 70 columns.

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The localization-config package is a tool aimed at automatic configuration of locales-related settings in several packages, most often desktop-related packages. It also configures the X-Window keyboard settings.
It is called from base-config except in the case the installed system has no localization at all.
The only translatable string is the package description, used as a menu entry in base-config.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: The localization-config package is maintained by the Debian-Edu project maintainers and is part of Debian-Edu's SVN repository.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the localization-config package.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: The translatable part only includes the base-config menu entry. It must be kept short: below 70 columns.

sect3.title: Contribute to language/locale support in localization-config
sect3.para: As localization-config pre-configures several packages for locales-related settings, translators should help its maintainer to adjust settings for their language. See for details.

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The console-common package includes all tools for handling the console (input and output).

It is installed and configured as part of the Debian base system. Its configuration process involves some user input and may be shown to users during a base system install, in some occasions (but not always).

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the console-common package.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: N/A

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The dictionaries-common package includes all common tools for using word dictionaries in Debian.

It is installed and configured as part of the Debian base system. Its configuration process inputs the user for choosing a word dictionary when the installation is run at medium priority (using the expert mode of install...or when some problem occurred earlier in the installation process).

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: This package is a regular Debian package. The package maintainer currently does no use any CVS or SVN repository.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the dictionaries-common package.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: N/A
